text: Lil Peep was an American rap musician and performer. He was known prior to his death to have written and recorded material that has never been officially released. His first posthumous album, Come Over When You're Sober, Pt. 2 was a compilation of unreleased material from the late artist. His music estate is currently signed with Columbia Records. ==Key== {| class="wikitable" |- |bgcolor="#EEDD82"| || Denotes material Åhr (or his associates) unofficially shared on the Internet |- |bgcolor="#0279FF"| || Denotes leaked songs |- |bgcolor="#D0F0C0"| || Denotes songs played in public |- |bgcolor="#FFEFD5"| || Denotes the song has been held unreleased |} ==Songs== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="font-size:95%; width=1250; text- align:center;" ! scope="col" style="width: 15%;" |Song ! scope="col" |Feature(s) ! class="unsortable" scope="col" |Notes ! class="unsortable" scope="col" | |- | style="background-color: #FFEFD5;" |"Already Grown" ||| * Song was recorded sometime from 2015 through 2016. | |- | style="background- color: #0279FF;" |"Black Clothes" |Cold Hart|| * Cold Hart's email was hacked and the song was leaked onto his SoundCloud in July 2018. It was deleted soon after he got his account back. | |- | style="background-color: #0279FF;" |"Bullet" |Air|| * It was recorded in 2016. It was leaked prior to his death in 2017. | |- | style="background-color: #0279FF;" |"Ballin'" |ILoveMakonnen|| * A snippet of the song is played in a trailer for the project between ILoveMakonnen & Åhr. Recorded in 2017, produced by MoneyPosse. | |- | style="background-color: #0279FF;" |"Bye Bye" |ILoveMakonnen|| * Expected for the ILoveMakonnen collaboration album. The song title can be found on the tracklist photo that was leaked. Recorded in 2017, produced by MoneyPosse. | |- | style="background-color: #0279FF;" |"Cruise 4 U" |ILoveMakonnen|| * Expected for the ILoveMakonnen collaboration album. Originally supposed to be released for an unreleased project entitled "Drink More Water 7". Snippets of the song have been released through ILoveMakonnen and Smokeasac. Recorded in 2017, produced by ILoveMakonnen and Danny Wolf. | |- |- | style="background- color: #0279FF;" |"Daggers" |Bexey|| * Leaked in December 2018. * Produced by Clams Casino just like its sampled A$AP Rocky song "LVL" from Long. Live. ASAP. | |- | style="background-color: #FFEFD5;" |"Drugs on Me (Glorified)" ||| * Lederrick, the producer of this song shared a snippet of it on his Instagram account. | |- | style="background-color: #0279FF;" |"Don't Lose Focus" |ILoveMakonnen|| * Expected for the ILoveMakonnen collaboration album. * Recorded in 2017, produced by MoneyPosse. * Leaked on the 4th of August, 2019. | |- | style="background-color: #FFEFD5;" |"Down Down Down" ||| * Unreleased collaboration between producer, Smokeasac and Åhr. Released in 2013, but was taken down. Smokeasac shared a thirty-second snippet of it on his Instagram account in 2018. | |- | style="background-color: #0279FF;" |"Coke Nails" |Bexey|| * Teased in a snippet back in August 2017. Shared on Instagram live in 2018 by Bexey and played in front of an audience also by him. * It leaked in full CDQ in August 2020 | |- | style="background-color: #FFEFD5;" |"Junkie" | smd || * Speculated song to feature Lil Pump. | |- | style="background- color: #0279FF;" |"Latitude" ||| * Assumed to be the earliest song from Åhr unreleased. This song was unearthed to have released around 2014, but was swiftly deleted soon after. A friend of Åhr's, Brennan Savage showed a snippet of a music video for the song, which went unreleased. A full low quality version of the song leaked in June 2020 through a stream. | |- | style="background-color: #EEDD82;" |"Lick" |Yung Goth|| * Leaked in 2018 on an Instagram live from Yung Goth. | |- | style="background-color: #0279FF;" |"Lost In The Mail" |Ricky Hil|| * Leaked in 2018. Supposedly, one of many songs from an unreleased collaboration project with Ricky Hil. | |- | style="background-color: #EEDD82;" |"My Turn" ||| * Shared at a tribute gathering for the one year anniversary of Åhr's passing on November 15, 2018. Produced by Yung Cortex. | |- | style="background-color: #0279FF;" |"Nightmares" |Teddy|| * Leaked in 2018. | |- | style="background-color: #FFEFD5;" |"On The Highway" ||| * An old video of the song can be found surfacing the internet of Åhr and his friends listening along to it. | |- | style="background-color: #FFEFD5;" |"One More" |Germ|| * Supposedly to be released on an unreleased Germ project. | |- | style="background-color: #0279FF;" |"One Last Time" |Blayne B|| * It was recorded in 2017 with Blayne B and Love-Sadkid. * An alternate version Contain an extra verse from Canadian rapper Dax. | |- | style="background-color: #FFEFD5;" |"One More Chance" ||| * Unreleased song that was used for "Broken Smile (My All)" off of Come Over When You're Sober, Pt. 2. | |- | style="background-color: #FFEFD5;" |"Please Don't" ||| * Was originally to be released on Come Over When You're Sober, Pt. 2. * Produced by Produced by IIVI & Smokeasac. | |- | style="background-color: #FFEFD5;" |"get you high" |Gab3| * Was originally to be released on Come Over When You're Sober, Pt. 2. * Produced by Produced by IIVI & Smokeasac. | |- | style="background-color: #EEDD82;" |"Suck The Tip" |Lil Tracy|| * Recorded in 2017. Parts of the song were leaked by, Bighead on Instagram live in early 2019. | |- | style="background-color: #0279FF;" |"Me and You" |Cold Hart|| *Produced by Charlie Shuffler. * Åhr's verse had been recorded around the time of his 2016 mixtape, Crybaby, and was intended for Cold Hart to feature before the file had gone missing. * Cold Hart found the original file on an old laptop on Halloween of 2018 and finished the song thereafter with the song expected for an official release, presumably with other songs by various producers for a posthumous Lil Peep project, but was subsequently leaked on the 8th of August, 2019. * The track officially released on the 27th of July, 2020. | |- | style="background-color: #FFEFD5;" |"16 Lines (Remix)" |Juicy J|| * Juicy J posted an unreleased verse to 16 Lines on his instagram back in 2019. | |- | style="background-color: #0279FF;"|"IDGAF (Remix)" | |Juice Wrld |• Leaked in June 2020 | |- | style="background-color: #FFEFD5;"|"Sex With My Ex (Remix)" | Juice Wrld |• Its known to exist due to people in the leaking community (primarily Googly from the Juice side and Sins34 from the Peep side) but its unknown as to when it'll leak or release. | |- | style="background- color: #FFEFD5;"|"Falling Down (Remix)" |Juice Wrld & XXXTentacion |• Its known to exist due to people in the leaking community (primarily Googly from the Juice side and Sins34 from the Peep side) but its unknown as to when it'll leak or release. | |- |Toys |Ricky Hil |• Leaked in May 2020 • Produced by Ricky Hil | |- |} == References == *Unreleased Category:Lists of songs recorded by American artists
title: List of unreleased songs recorded by Lil Peep
